meanings.definition: To add as a supplement or accessory
meanings.sent1: I will append a note to the end of my report.
meanings.sent2: She likes to append stickers to her notebook.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to append a sprinkle of glitter to the dessert.
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to append a touch of warmth to the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist wanted to append a pop of color to the painting.

meanings.sent1: Please append your signature at the bottom of the page.
meanings.sent2: He will append the document to the email before sending it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to append the acorn to the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to append joy to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The magnet was able to append the paperclip to the fridge.

meanings.definition: To include as part of something else
meanings.sent1: Let's append the new data to the existing spreadsheet.
meanings.sent2: The professor will append the references to the research paper.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to append itself to the group of dogs.
meanings.sent4: His dedication seemed to append value to the team.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle piece will append perfectly to the empty space.
